comments.body: `Serde` is referenced elsewhere in the deprecated overloads. I think this is the only instance in `KGroupedTable` where a new overload references `Serde` instead of `Materialized`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +642,646 @@     * for example, allows the result to have a different type than the input values.
     * If the result value type does not match the {@link StreamsConfig#VALUE_SERDE_CLASS_CONFIG default value
     * serde} you should use {@link #aggregate(Initializer, Aggregator, Aggregator, Materialized)}.
     * The result is written into a local {@link KeyValueStore} (which is basically an ever-updating materialized view)
     * provided by the given {@code storeSupplier}.
